skills.name: React
skills.description: React is my go-to front-end framework. With its system of reusable components with states, React makes making modern web applications enjable and easy. I am experienced building complex multi-page applications using React Router and can connect a back-end to my React applications with ease. The majority of my web applications use React for the front-end.

skills.name: Go
skills.description: Go is the back-end language I have the most experience in. I am skilled in creating RESTful APIs that can seemlessly connect the front-end to the database. In addition, I have built complex features such as accounts, comments & comment replys and Oauth integration into my Go backends.

skills.name: SQL
skills.description: SQL is my favorite way to build a database. I am well-versed in all parts of the process, from building the database schema in 3rd-normal form from the necessary requirements to creating stored procedures and functions to make the database easier to use. The main way I use SQL is through Microsoft SQL Server.

skills.name: Python
skills.description: Python is my favorite language for building small scripts that interact with various public APIs. In addition, it is my go-to language for data science, utilizing tools such as Numpy, Pandas, Scikit-learn and Beautiful Soup.

skills.name: AWS
skills.description: Amazon Web Services is my go-to cloud provider for hosting my back-ends. Utilizing EC2 instances to run my Docker containers, I can get my sites up and running within the hour. I am also experienced in using Route 54 to configure a custom domain name with the correct DNS settings.

skills.name: Docker
skills.description: Docker is my favorite way to containerize my code to deploy to the cloud. I am experienced in deploying Go, MySQL and R containers and can connect them together in multi-container applications.

skills.name: R
skills.description: R is another favorite of mine for small scripts that utilize various public APIs. I am also experienced in using it for data cleaning, web scraping and other tasks that are necessary parts of larger projects.

skills.name: Java
skills.description: Java was my first programming language, and the skills I learned from it made learning new languages much easier. Java taught me object-orientated programming, data structures like stacks, linked-lists and trees and exposed me to topics such as recursion. In addition, I am experienced in implementing various search, sorting and graph algorithms in Java.

skills.name: MySQL
skills.description: MySQL is my go-to database for building server side infrastructure. Easily containerized and connected to the back-end, MySQL allows me to use my SQL skills to build efficent and future-proof back-ends for my applications.

skills.name: Github
skills.description: Github is my go-to source control and colaboration tool, and I am experienced in utilizing multiple branches, merging and using pull requests. Many of my applications use continuous integration through Github, automatically pushing new changes to the live site with a commit to the specified branch.
